title: Sophie Monk reveals the reason why people fall in love on reality TV
text:
She knows a thing or two about unlucky-in-love reality shows.

And it seems Sophie Monk has figured out why people tend to fall in love on them so easily.

On Friday, the 39-year-old former Bachelorette told 9 Now: 'I think people forget how isolated you are without your phone, not knowing about news - you've got nothing.'

The secret is out! On Friday, Sophie (pictured) told 9 Now: 'I think people forget how isolated you are without your phone, not knowing about news — you've got nothing.'

'So all you've got to focus on is love,' said the Love Island Australia host, adding that three days on a reality show can feel like three months.

'I know from shows I've done that... it can feel like years, like you've known these people forever,' she said.

In an interview with Who magazine last month, Sophie offered up a few teasers from the forthcoming season of Love Island Australia, which she calls 'insane'.

Lucky in love: Sophie (right) has been dating businessman Joshua Gross (left) for a little over a year, after they first met on a long-haul flight

'There will be a few surprises... [and couples] will be tested to see if they last. It sounds harsh, but it's just like real life,' she said.

In the interview, Sophie also offered up the following piece of advice to the latest batch of genetically blessed, realty TV wannabes with stars in their eyes and lust in their hearts.

'It sounds so cliche but you have to be yourself,' confessed Sophie, who's currently dating chiselled businessman Joshua Gross.

'The real you is always revealed anyway... you can only hold up for so long,' added the blonde bombshell.

'You are in an environment where you're in front of 60 cameras and microphones. It's going to come out.

'If you are an a***hole, be an a***hole. If you are nice, be nice. Just own it!'

Love Island Australia premieres Monday, October 7 at 8.45pm on Channel Nine
